node.title: Supreme Court scrutinizes tuition program in religious liberty case
node.description: A decision from the Supreme Court is expected by summer of 2022.

node.title: Facebook delays January office deadline for its workers
node.description: Parent company Meta will allow employees to work remotely for an additional three to five months.

node.title: The best places to work in 2021, ranked
node.description: Glassdoor has ranked large employers across the US... and a lot of the big tech companies aren't at the top

node.title: The Oscars Are Broken. Here’s How to Fix Them.
node.description: The ratings flop that was the last ceremony provided useful lessons in what not to do. But there are steps the academy can take for an actually enjoyable evening.

node.title: Getting Married in the Metaverse
node.description: One couple’s recent nuptials in the virtual world known as the metaverse showcase the possibilities of having a wedding unfettered by the bounds of reality.

node.title: Arlene Shuler to Step Down as President of New York City Center
node.description: Shuler, a former dancer, has run the theater since 2003, instituting its popular Fall for Dance series.

node.title: Chinese Hackers Targeting Southeast Asia Nations Likely State-Sponsored, U.S. Company Says
node.description: U.S. cybersecurity threat researchers at Insikt Group identified over 400 servers across Southeast Asia affected by Chinese malware.

node.title: Saudi Man Mistakenly Identified as One of Jamal Khashoggi's Killers Freed by France
node.description: The misidentified man reportedly shares the same name as one of Khashoggi's suspected killers, Khalid Aedh al-Otaibi.

node.title: Waitress Confronts 'Rude' Customer Accused of 'Looking at Underaged Girls' in Viral Video
node.description: "You're a pedophile and a freak and you deserve to be locked up at Bellevue," the waitress said.

node.title: Athletes challenging selectors in record numbers
node.description: Aggrieved athletes who believe they've wrongly missed out on national selection are taking on the decision-makers in record numbers.

node.title: Time running out to post Christmas presents - NZ Post
node.description: New Zealand Post says this Christmas has been its busiest ever with 2.4 million parcels being sent across the country last week, an increase of up to 250,000 parcels on the same time last year. Audio

node.title: Will Forte Is Still Waiting for ‘MacGruber’ to Blow Up
node.description: In a new Peacock series, Forte returns as the unruly “Saturday Night Live” action hero who’s once again reckoning with bombs (including his 2010 movie).

node.title: Who was Daunte Wright?
node.description: Mr. Wright, who was killed by an officer during a traffic stop, had been trying to improve his life for his young son, according to those who knew him.

node.title: Justo Gallego, Who Built a Cathedral, Brick by Brick, Dies at 96
node.description: A former monk, he spent decades constructing a grand edifice as an act of faith and devotion, and did so almost single-handedly.

node.title: Russia Says 'Impossible' to Revive Soviet Union Amid U.S. Concerns, Growing Nostalgia
node.description: While there's no clear plan to bring back the Soviet Union, Russian President Vladimir Putin has previously gained massive popularity with moves on Ukraine.

node.title: Pic's NZ-grown peanuts stacked up against imported nuts
node.description: Work is underway to see if peanuts grown here are as good as the ones imported to make peanut butter.

node.title: Six Air NZ workers, three gang members charged over drug smuggling
node.description: Police say Auckland Airport has been targeted by a syndicate smuggling drugs from the United States into New Zealand.

node.title: Officer "betrayed a 20-year-old kid" in killing Daunte Wright, prosecutor says
node.description: Kim Potter has said she meant to use her Taser on Daunte Wright, but that she grabbed her handgun instead.

node.title: White House addresses maternal mortality crisis in U.S.
node.description: The U.S. has the highest maternal death rate of any developed nation in the world.

node.title: Baseball’s ‘Court of Appeals’ Adds Six New Hall of Famers
node.description: A pair of old-timers’ committees corrected previous snubs, electing Buck O’Neil, Gil Hodges, Minnie Miñoso, Tony Oliva, Jim Kaat and Bud Fowler.

node.title: After Warm Start to Snow Season, Colorado Resorts Look for Relief
node.description: Record high temperatures have left mountain resorts across the state reliant on artificial snow. Winter storms predicted for this week could change that.

node.title: As the U.K. considers new restrictions, the government is accused of flouting rules last Christmas.
node.description: Critics have condemned a recording showing the prime minister’s staff joking about breaches of coronavirus restrictions last year, when Britain was in lockdown.

node.title: Three Huge Asteroids To Pass Earth in Last Days of 2021, Including One That's 850 Feet Wide
node.description: The largest of the asteroids could stand as tall as San Francisco's Golden Gate Bridge if they were placed side by side.

node.title: How Russia Reacted To Vladimir Putin and Joe Biden Talks
node.description: Russian media assessed the results of the virtual talk between the U.S. and Russian leaders on Tuesday.

node.title: Diplomatic Boycotts of Olympics Don't Work
node.description: Critics have accused the Biden administration of not going far enough, but Team USA argues that a full boycott of Beijing 2022 would not be effective either.

node.title: Jason Meade, Cop Charged in Casey Goodson's Death, Should Be Tried By State: Prosecutors
node.description: Prosecutors rejected the idea that because Meade was working for the U.S. Marshals Service before the shooting, he should be tried in federal court.

node.title: International Tennis Federation Won't Move China Events Despite Peng Shuai Safety Concerns
node.description: The ITF announced they will continue to hold tennis events in China because "We don't want to punish a billion people," said president David Haggerty.

node.title: Tiger Woods Returning to Golf With Son in Weekend Event That's Nearly a Sellout
node.description: "Although it's been a long and challenging year, I am very excited to close it out by competing in the PNC Championship with my son Charlie," Woods tweeted.

node.title: Police have arrested hundreds of suspected drug traffickers in a global sting, now they're going after their trusted insiders
node.description: Six months since the AFP revealed how Operation Ironside used an encrypted messaging app to listen in on organised criminals, the investigation has a new target.

node.title: The dodo had no predators in its native Mauritius. That was before the ships came
node.description: Has humanity learned its lesson after driving the dodo to extinction? With the environment and biodiversity still at risk, it doesn't seem so.
